H0.text: Weathering is the process that happens when rocks are broken down by both physical and chemical changes.

H1.text: Deposition is the process that occurs when rocks are broken down by both physical and chemical changes.

H2.text: Condensation is the process that occurs when rocks are broken down by both physical and chemical changes.

H3.text: Decomposing is what occurs when rocks are broken down by both physical and chemical changes.

A4.text: Physical weathering involves the breakdown of rocks into smaller fragments through processes such as expansion and contraction, mainly due to temperature changes.

A5.text: Chemical weathering takes place when water, oxygen, carbon dioxide, and other chemical substances react with rock to change its composition.
